/vm/ is a place to discuss all types of multiplayer games, whether on console, handheld, or PC, co-op or competitive, online or local.

Does this mean discussion of multiplayer games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vm/ is just a separate board specifically focused on multiplayer games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vm/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

threads.com:
This is the only conclusion I've been able to come to.

Being in a world with thousands of players seem fun at first but that only works when you’re a kid. Truth is it’s really boring. Meeting a good variety of NPCs is way more fun than meeting players that act the same way as in real life depressed emo wannabe. It’s funny how a lot of MMORPG players seek the role playing aspect through PC simulations of Tabletop RPGs that only display still images and do not realize that they could do the same in the 3D world they’re used to reside in… to a certain extent, which brings up my second point.

You have no impact on the world. Whether you like it or not I’m going to use pic related as an example because if you’re on this website you’ve seen it. Let’s say you have a world like the Aincrad where you need to defeat a floor boss to access the next area. Even if you just killed that boss, everybody still have to do the same. You somehow didn’t pave the way for other players. So you’re in the same world, but not really. Whatever you do do not matter and cannot reach others. The reason for that is obvious; most people wouldn’t be able to play the game. Ironically, somewhat large scale co-op games are better than MMORPGs if you want to experience a virtual world with other people because they allow less restrictions on that matter.

When it comes to gameplay, I wonder why so many people start drooling whenever they see the number of players allowed in raids increase although 40 players raids like in Ashes of Creation feels nothing like cooperating. At this point you’re literally a needle in a haystack, it doesn’t feel like you’re fighting anything, you don’t need to pay attention to the game at all. You’re only here to meet the number requirements of some purely stats-based fake difficulty.

>>757758
The Crafting Storage is deceptively broad in what you can put into it.
It can house
>Collectables
Things that normally go in the Red bag, like Strings of Prayer Beads, Singed Soarwood, and Mysterious Remnants
>Ingredients
Things that normally go in the Green bag, like Cannith Crafting Essences, Crafted Shards, Tattered Tapestries, and Dragon Scales
>Augments
Things that normally go in the Orange bag, like Topaz of Blindness Immunity, Ruby of [spellpower] that you slot into items to gain their benefits
>Filigrees
You'll get these after hitting level 20, they also go in the Orange bag and are used to power up your Sentient Weapon once you get one
>Other stuff
Trap Parts you get for disabling traps, holiday event items like Motes of Winter and the Dubloons from the pirate event, challenge ingredients, and even arrows(iirc)

As for what is trash, it primarily depends on what it's used to craft in Cannith Crafting. Runic Parchment, Glass Phial, and Executioner Beetle are used to craft Constitution which every class can always use.

https://ddowiki.com/page/Crafting_Collectables
check each collectable's page out to see what they can be crafted into

https://ddowiki.com/page/Collectable_Collectors
sometimes they can also be used as a gacha payment for augment, but it's both expensive in terms of how many collectables you need to trade, and unreliable in what you receive so it's generally not worth it unless you're overflowing with them

threads.com:
Welcome to /VM/abinogi. Mabinogi is a fun, once popular little old school Korean MMO from 2004 based around Celtic mythology with many different features. Your character can age, rebirth, eat food and gain weight, play and custom make music, and so much more. You can be anything and do anything all at once with no downsides. From non combat related skills like cooking, tailoring, blacksmithing, trading goods in a commerce, carpentry, etc. to different styles of combat like melee, magic, ninja, archery, puppetry, etc. all on 1 character. Although graphics and gameplay is still a bit dated, even after 14 years the game is still rich in content such as fashion contests, cooking contest, jousting, playing in or viewing large concerts, training pets, and so on and continues to be Nexon's most generous game.

>News and Events
https://mabinogi.nexon.net/news/all

>ALL SERVERS HAVE BEEN MERGED
>Many combat talents, life talents, commerce system, field bosses have been revamped
>New Hybrid Talents coming called Arcana talents

>11/17/2022
>Skill training, Renown, Grandmaster, and Crusader skills will become a lot easier to train(lowered training requirements)


>[Guilds]
We currently have a guild called Mabigen. Our guild stone is located by the Taillteann graveyard. Apply by mentioning you're from /vm/.

threads.name: /bng/ - BallisticNG Saturday races
threads.com:
>What is this game?
BallisticNG is a PC anti-gravity racing game available on Steam for $8, based mostly on Wip3out, with optional mechanics from the newer Wipeout games.
If you like going fast, good tunes, and good fun, this game is for you.

>How do I join?
Get the game (Grab the Outer Reaches DLC for $3 if you want, though not required as we mostly play custom tracks anyway).
Download and install the track pack (instructions in the pastebin).
Launch the game, go to Multiplayer, and join what is most likely the only public Steam lobby online. If we are playing in an IP lobby (piratefag friendly) it will be designated at the end of this post or within the thread.

Everything else you need will be here:
https://pastebin.com/tHrNfZdv
Make sure you get the Trackpack
Newest Trackpack (last updated: 2022/09/22):
https://mega.nz/file/m4gHVJQJ#_ay4DAvFLsQ4hlHzDrsZp_9uGjyyVQucGb4HSSdTA_I
Newest Minipack, get this if you're just updating your track pack:
https://mega.nz/file/el4jFCzT#-0lH7G1ENVLM-9lfUE4a11DAwksbw2xPEvzhDfWd6yo
See pastebin for instructions on how to install or update your pack without causing the game to fail to recognize which tracks you have installed.

>How do I play?
Anon guide will be posted, there's 3 parts covering most basics.
Try to practice airbraking and things for a little bit using the Campaign's practice mode before jumping right in otherwise you'll probably have a hard time.
We can also answer any questions you might have, either here or within the lobby.

>I'm bad and not going to win!
Once you get above the skill floor anyone can win races due to their chaotic nature.
Also we always get newfriends who will match your skill level.

We also have a steam group: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ballisticnv
This is used just for organizing race sessions, no circlejerking.

last_replies.com: Been playing Overprime since the final test dropped. I can tell you a lot about it. It's more of a brawler that happens to have lanes. Everyone but jungler gets the option to start with a blink/flash. One thing I personally don't like is that killing Orb Prime does damage to enemy towers, and if one inhibitor is down, the enemy core takes 60% damage. Lanes having only one tower is odd too. They tried to make it be more fast paced, yet it can draw out to 40 minutes easily if there aren't decent team wipes. Pushing a lane means nothing due to how piss easy it is to wave clear. I personally tank inhibitors and towers because they don't do shit and even a caster and a tank hitting it can take it down in just a few seconds. The items are ok, the jungle item is basically the one from LoL, potions are next to useless due to how long they take to get the full hp/mana. All in all, it's good to me and decent chance I'll stick with it, unless Predecessor just blows it out of the water.

threads.sub: /LFG/ - Small MMORPG looking for group general
threads.com:
Do you play an MMORPG (or private server) that is generally too small to level with other people either because everyone else is at level cap, group leveling is considered outdated, or because there is just not enough people to form groups for group content? Is there an MMORPG or private server that you would play if there were people to level with? Or maybe you're looking for a new MMORPG (or private server) to play with some people.

This is not a thread to find people to play popular MMORPGs with (Guild Wars 2, World of Warcraft or its more popular private servers, New World, Lost Ark, FFXIV, CoH Homecoming, Return of Reckoning, etc). This is for the dead, dying, or just very small MMORPGs (or at least the ones in which it is a struggle or impossible to find people for group content while leveling) such as EverQuest I and II, LotRO, DDO, Asheron's Call, Age of Conan, and small private servers. As ultimately I do not know which ones exactly are hard to find groups for, this is up to your discretion and is ultimately a thread guideline.

Only advertise here if you are serious about helping form a leveling group or even a community (such as a guild) on your game. Coordinate with people on times (if a group) or simply a server and faction/realm (if a guild/community).

last_replies.com:
>>757684
>Is the game's upgrade system P2W/Vindictus style?
While not as brutal as some older KMMOs like Ace Online, BDO's enhancement system used to be a lot more bullshit that made people quit the game. Still is when it comes to the higher end of items, but materials are nowhere near as anal as they used to be, the devs went transparent about the actual odds, there are more lenient means to start with a higher failstack, etc. Someone paying money can melt down costumes for more protected attempts but the amount of Cron Stones needed scales up accordingly.

>Do I have to devote more than 3 hours/day to get shit done
Depends on what it is you're doing. Korean games are about that grind, you do get at least one hour of private mob grinding in select spots these days if you don't want to deal with people contesting them. Doing a few hours of grind each day would definitely make you wealthier though. There are dailies/weeklies but most of them don't take that long and it depends on how relevant they are to what you want to do.

>Do I have to hand in a resume to join end game raids/parties?
World bosses are the closest PvE thing and that's just people coming and going freely as they dogpile onto them; as long as you have appropriate gear they're lax. The actual relevance of these bosses also vary. PvP is a bit different with Conquests and Node Wars, and is taken more seriously.

last_replies.com:
Port Forwarding Guide [EASY MODE]
This is a simpler guide for portforwarding, however it's extremely vague and probably won't help much. Check the advanced version below if it doesn't help you.

1
Open your web browser.

2
Enter your gateway IP address in the address bar (ex. http://192.168.1.1 or http://192.168.0.1)
You can find this by entering "ipconfig /all" into command prompt.
Example: http://i.imgur.com/3HoEnxi.png

3
Log in with your username and password for the router
Look up your router's default user and password here: http://www.routerpasswords.com/
If its not in there, you will have to know your modem or router's model number and use Google.

If the default password doesn't work, somebody has already changed it and you will have to ask whoever owns the router or modem.

4
Find the Port Forwarding section. Sometimes its called Applications/Games/Services section.
Example: http://i.imgur.com/b2ilVdY.png

5
Enter the numbers 7778-7780 for both external and internal port ranges. Set the type to "TCP/UDP" or "Both"

You will need to make separate TCP and UDP entries if you don't have a "TCP/UDP" or "Both" option.

6
Enter your computer's LAN IP address as the IP address for the ports.
Find this by using "ipconfig /all" in command prompt again.
Example: http://i.imgur.com/GoL7vdR.png

7
Click apply/save/whatever. Run server, see if people join.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>757330
God. APB. I remember that shit so much. I was SO hyped for it. I had played a ton of gmod RP growing up (which basically is heavily based around cops vs criminals at the time). So I thought this was going to be that but on steroids. Preordered it. Upgraded my computer for it. I.was.ready. God damn what a disappointment. Performance issues and lack luster combat. I think the biggest issue is they didn't predict how shitty players can be. The amount of hacking after a few weeks into launch was absolutely insane. The game had like no anti cheat at launch. Griefing was also insane. The ability of players to interact with other players who are in the middle of a mission. Blocking objectives with cars and shit. They tried to fix it and players found a way around it. Completely ruined missions. They also hyped it up to be more open world based and free. Instead it was just "wait around for a mission". Missions were also pretty meh and frustrating.

Amazon customization though all around. Loved the radio options + whole music dynamic. And the most fun I had was going on "patrol" as a cop, looking for criminals doing crimes, spotting them, then engaging in a chase. They should've built on that dynamic instead of mission spam.

I still remember the advertisements. With people I think getting tattoos and cutting their hair for a marketing campaign they did for the game. Hopefully they got paid well lol.

Games still got a small following. Someone bought the IP a few years ago and said they were going to improve everything. Guess the games built on shit code cause things fell apart when they upgraded the engine in testing. Last update sounds like they're still working on trying to upgrade multiple back end components and engine related stuff. Improve performance and get it to a working state. Hopefully one day they'll get the ball rolling on it.

From wii.guide/wiimmfi:
>Wii (no homebrew)
1. Insert your game disc.
2. Go into your internet connection settings and set the DNS server of your console to 95.217.77.151.
3. Go to the WC24 contract information (third button after clicking on “Internet” in the settings).
4. Confirm that you do want to use WC24 and the shop channel
5. The Wiimmfi patcher page should show up. If it doesn’t, and you still see the default license agreement, your router might not be compatible with this method.
6. Wait for about 1 minute and 30 seconds for the patcher to load
The game should now start with the Wiimmfi patch included
>Nintendo DS
You'll need a Wi-Fi network with WEP or no security
1. Go in the Nintendo DS Wi-Fi settings. This can be accessed inside the game you want to play online with.
2. Set up a connection.
3. Type in 164.132.44.106 as the primary DNS.
4. Type in 1.1.1.1 as the secondary DNS (if it gives you problems, try 8.8.8.8).
5. Save your connection settings and perform a connection test. If it’s successful, then you’re ready to play.

>>756391
Thrusters' thermal load stat only comes into play while actively under thrust, and has no effect while in SC.
The increased heat in SC comes entirely from the increased power draw because your power plant generates heat proportional to your total power draw at all times. And clean drives draws more power than dirty. Only reinforced doesn't increase your heat generation in SC. No thruster mod actually decreases your heat output in SC.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
In multiplayer, there are clean, semi clean, dirty and no rule servers (where you can go drive the track backwards with a 5000kg harvester). Depending on the server and player count, you goal can be making lap records, or placing as high by optimizing the car's speed an defense, or go full tank and cornerbomb people (crashing into them at full speed when they slow down to take the corner). There is skill and strategy in spinning out cars from behind, cornerbombing, and dodging a cornerbomb, cars have different characteristics, some maintain speed better at corners, others are faster in straights, some are good/bad in rough terrain. You can adjust armor, suspension, differential (which affects how wheels spin in corners) and gear ratios to fit the track and server rules.

Very physics-based gameplay, like walking on a tightrope trying to keep your balance and adjust to conditions. Once you master the cars and tracks, you can go back after a break and perform just as well.

Netcode is good, everything is predicted, there's no input lag nor desync, but the higher ping you have to the server, the more glitchy collisions will be. On low ping it's almost equivalent to single player. Gear netcode is bugged and you get slightly better lap times in local play.

After playing a few years for thousand hours, I quit because there's just not meaningful content, it's all just casual gameplay on 3rd party servers, it's the old-school way which has it's advantages and problems. Newer cars are also not balanced in terms of lap time ability, some are just faster.

Crash compilation (the game is actually like that all the time and it's very fun):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4KaADP7W3no
Example of good lap record:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rw7IoXXUSVk
